intro: Monolena guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan monolena, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded or semi-shaded conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
